Authors: Liu, XY; Wu, KQ; Zhang, P
Book Editors: Zhang, S; Feng, Z; Zhao, H; Zhang, H
Author Full Names: Liu Xiaoyong; Wu Keqiang; Zhang Peng
Article Title: Evaluation of Operational Efficiency in Shanxi Regional Tourism Based on DEA Method and Malmquist Index
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: DEA Model; Malmquist Index; Regional Tourism Operational Efficiency
Abstract: Developing low-carbon economy and green economy has become the trend of the future, it is an inevitable choice that vigorously develops tourism as well as optimize and upgrade the industrial structure for the future development. What is more, Shanxi tourism income in 2008 reached 73.93 billion Yuan, the growth rate reached as high as 27.1%, tourism industry maintains rapid growth in spite of economic recession, tourism drawing great attention from all cities owing to its wonderful performance, every cities expect to have great development of tourism. For this reason, evaluating the efficiency of tourism development in the areas is necessary. By applying data envelopment analysis (DEA) method and Malmquist index, our study makes evaluations for the operating performance of the tourism industry in areas of Shanxi Province. So we estimate the overall efficiency, technical efficiency, scale efficiency, input redundancy rate and output rate of the tourism industry in areas, this study found the problem in the development of tourism of every cities, thus, we make some recommendations for policy-making departments on the tourism development.

At the current there are many countries which are building Eco-cities and have achieved a number of preliminary results. In this paper, the model of the Eco-city construction were structured and explained carefully. At last, according to the dynamic model and integrating the Taiyuan actual situation, the paper analysis the internal power resource and the external power resource.

Book Editors: Zhang, S; Feng, Z; Zhao, H; Zhang, H
Article Title: Analysis on Effect of Financial Environment on Real Estate Price Based on ECM
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Financial Environment; Real Estate Price; Short-Term Effect; Long-Term Effect
Abstract: In this paper, the author constructs multi-variables error correction model between housing sale price index and GDP, loan interest rate of five years, money supply, middle-term and long-term loan scale by quarterly data of Chinese real estate price index and some indexes in financial field from 2000 to 2010, and analyzes the effect of financial environment on real estate price. The results show that the effect of loan interest rate changing on real estate price is the most significant both in the short run and in the long run, that is to say, loan interest rate is the most effective instrument to controlling the fluctuation of real estate price. Therefore, government can control real estate price by decreasing the financial support for real estate industry when there exists real estate bubbles, especially by decreasing loan interest rate.

Abstract: Landscape estate refers to the tourist resort for the purpose of landscape estate development and marketing model, all or parts of its projects achieve to tourism function. The opportunities of international tourism island construction in Hainan island will develop the landscape estate of Hainan. Although landscape estate in Hainan has its inherent environmental advantages, there are some issues, such as economy relatively backward, the lack of professional and so on. This paper will analyze the strengths and weaknesses of the development of landscape estate in Hainan, then we also put forward some feasible measures to develop the landscape estate in Hainan, including improve law and regulation, scientific planning and rational development, strengthen innovation, build local brands and Strengthen the development of professional.

Abstract: Based on the analysis of water asset management performance indicators, the author proposed a model of performance evaluation which was based on entropy theory and can be used in water asset management. The author also made an empirical study on one of reservoir in Changsha city. It was an example to indicate that the method is feasible.

Article Title: The Relationship of Opening Degree and China's Inbound Tourism
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Inbound Tourism; Opening Degree; Timetable; Provincial Difference
Abstract: Opening degree is an important factor to inbound tourism. A temporal analysis of timetable and regional difference discovered: with the higher degree of opening door policy from 1985-2005, China's inbound tourism has been growing and dependence of 5 key indicators are all over 0.79 and showed very good relevance at several turning points; furthermore, with the statistics of 2002, the relationship between the opening degrees of 31 provinces and their inbound tourism market shares are positive relevance, of which, Guangdong, Beijing, Shanghai, Fujian, Zhejiang, Jiangsu, Shandong and Liaoning are both inbound tourism advanced and economy exotic provinces; finally, a comparison study of 15 years of Shaanxi and Shandong Provinces is made to retell the same result.

Article Title: The Researches on Overseas R&D Investment of Chinese Enterprises*-Based on the Case Study of HUAWEI and DMTG
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Overseas R&D Investment; Case Study; Innovation Ability
Abstract: In recent years, the overseas research and development (R&D) investment of Chinese enterprises has aroused a universal attention. Based on the case study of HUAWEI and Dalian Machine Tool Group (DMTG), this essay analyzes the overseas R&D investment by Chinese corporations, discusses the prominent role that the overseas investment plays in improving innovation ability, probes into the experience and obstacle, and makes a comparison between two enterprises about the rules of overseas R&D investment. Besides, this essay proposes some suggestions for Chinese enterprises' overseas R&D investment.

Abstract: More and more organizations recognize the importance of informatization. IT project can contribute significantly to raising the level of informatization, yet IT projects results are not satisfactory. How to effectively increase the effectiveness of IT project has become a challenge for many organizations. This article describes 6 sigma management and explores on how to use 6 sigma to promote IT project implementation.

Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: E-commerce; Supervision; Compare
Abstract: How to carry out effective supervision of E-commerce development is a major issue to be resolved for China While guiding the development of the e-commerce healthy and orderly. As the manager of the market order, the government needs to strengthen the effective supervision of E-commerce and fulfill the responsibility as the market supervisor to ensure that the market develop healthy and orderly. This article summarizes the supervision experience of some developed countries about E-commerce and puts forward some countermeasures which reply with Chinese E-commerce supervision.

Authors: Zhao, XD; Yan, JY; Qie, SJ
Book Editors: Zhang, S; Feng, Z; Zhao, H; Zhang, H
Author Full Names: Zhao Xiaodong; Yan Jingyi; Qie Shaojian
Article Title: Utility Maximization of Package Products in Service
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Package Product; McDonald's Set-meal; Utility of Products Compositing; Utility maximization
Abstract: Following the development of the logistics and electronic commence, it is more and more popular for package products. In this article, we study the compositing of package products, the price of commodity composition, the utility of commodity composition and the maximization of the utility, and we analyze the McDonald's commodity composition and point out the shortcut approach of utility maximization of McDonald's commodity composition decided by the characteristic of McDonald's commodity composition structure. Through analyzing the influence of the price balance of the set-meal on the optimization of McDonald's product consumption, we raise the general approach of commodity composition optimization of usual package product. Package product has an important impact on modern service commodity economy, so corresponding study could fit the specialism of modern economy, which is worthwhile to study new economic questions for us in theory and practice.

Authors: Shen, YJ; Wang, N; Zhang, ZH
Book Editors: Zhang, S; Feng, Z; Zhao, H; Zhang, H
Author Full Names: Shen Yajun; Wang Ning; Zhang Zhaohui
Article Title: A Theoretical Analysis of Real Estate Investment and Urban Housing Price Dynamics in China
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Real Estate Investment; Urban Housing Price; Dynamics; China
Abstract: With the conversion of the housing provision system, the cost of commodity residential housing in China increased quickly. There are some variables which causes enhance of real estate investment scales and increase in urban housing prices in China. Based on literature review on Chinese urban housing growth, this paper develops a theoretical analytic framework of real estate investment scales and urban housing dynamics growth in China. China's remarkable economic growth has been accompanied by the real estate investment scales, and is bound to cause the increase in housing prices; Population growth and household income become the effective demands for real estate investment scales and the increase in housing prices partly; Limitation of household registration system and regional variations in the urbanization level and social welfare institution lead to regional variations in the real estate investment and housing price increase; The income of domestic speculative capital and the inflow of international hot money have driven up property prices volatilities, and have accelerated a worrisome bubble in China.

Author Keywords: Economic Center; Central China Rising; Population and Labor System; Economic System; Social Development System
Abstract: The establishment of economic center is essentially a comprehensive evaluation process on the existing and potential economic strength of a city. The economic center of the cities established not by a single index, but the comprehensive index system established. This article intended to be used three kinds of integrated indicators system to evaluate scientifically, namely: population and labor system, economic system and social development and infrastructure systems, finally we can see Wuhan is the economic center in six provinces of central china.

The paper, using teachers' assessment database as an object of some higher university, analyzes assessment database by using Bayesian classification technique, gives teachers assessment a scientific, objective and just classification results, and provides teaching administration a scientific basis of selecting teachers.

Authors: Zhou, ZX; Li, X; Zhang, B
Book Editors: Zhang, S; Feng, Z; Zhao, H; Zhang, H
Author Full Names: Zhou Zhaoxia; Li Xin; Zhang Bao
Article Title: A Research Study on the Biogas Construction and Utilization in the Beijing Countryside - Based on an Investigation in Daxing District, Beijing
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Rural Biogas; Household Biogas; Biogas Engineering Project; Service
Abstract: In recent years, the development of biogas is rapidly and the biogas construction can be seen in many places in the Beijing countryside. Our investigation into the household biogas and biogas engineering projects in Daxing District, Beijing shows that the requirement of one digester with three remodels has not been followed, the quality of biogas digester.construction is very poor, the management of digesters is far from satisfactory, and biogas engineering projects lack a price mechanism and market operation in their management. In order to cope with these problems, this paper puts forward a proposal to promote the sound development of biogas in the Beijing rural areas which includes increasing government support, enhancing supervision, strengthening service functions, establishing a price mechanism and other measures aiming to improve the efficiency of biogas utilization and government investments.

Book Editors: Zhang, S; Feng, Z; Zhao, H; Zhang, H
Article Title: A Method of Competitiveness Evaluation for Foreign Competitors of Wind Turbine Manufacturing Industry in China Market
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Industry Competitive Intelligence; Competitiveness; Evaluation; Method; Wind Power; Competitor; Case; Empirical Study
Abstract: Base on wind turbine manufacturing industry of China, from industry competitive intelligence point of view, oriented to the need of native wind turbine manufacture enterprises of China for getting competitive advantage in domestic market of China, identify the foreign competitors in China market, and analyze the competitors focusing on four fields, then evaluate the competitiveness of foreign competitors in China market. The identification method of foreign competitors is base on the wind power industry history and current situation of China. Three phases past, current and future, are studying focusing on competitors, according to enterprise's market share both in China market and in the world market, 5 foreign competitors are identified with comprehensive study of analysis and contrast finally. Base on point of view of competitor profile in industry competitive intelligence level,the foreign competitor analysis method focus on four fields: (1) back ground; (2) products, technology and management; (3) development in world market; (4) development in China market. In industry competitive intelligence level, a method of competitiveness evaluation for foreign competitors in domestic market of China is developed. The major procedures of the competitiveness evaluation method are: (1) base on a indicators system with five first class indicators and nineteen second class indicators, establish a competitiveness evaluation model, given the definition and measure rule for each indicator; (2) according to analysis of each competitor get data for each indicator, and get score of each indicator according to measure rule; (3) weigh the indicators by experts group scoring; (4) measure the competitiveness of each foreign competitor with weigh quantitative score finally.

Article Title: The Rule of Five for the Cities Competitive Strategies' Positioning
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: 5 Rule; GDP Share; City Positioning; Competition Strategy
Abstract: The Research shows there is a linear relationship between GDP share(GDPS) and personal average GDP(PGDP) of Cities in the provinces, the Formulae is GDPS=2.618PGDP. This papers also presents the Rule of Five for City Competitive Strategies' positioning in China, which is similar with the Rule of Three. The Rule of Five point out that the accumulated GDP share of top five cities in the provinces in China are respectively 20%140%/50%/60%/70%, GDPS of both the first and the second biggest cities are close to 25% and 18%,they are equalizing the top 3 companies in the industrial field described by the Rule of Three, Other Top 3 cities' GDP shares are close to 10%/8%/6%,they are expert cities matching with Expert Companies in industries fields.

Article Title: The Empirical Study of Education Industry Spurring Hengshui Economic Development
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Education Industry; Economic Development; Hengshui
Abstract: Through developing education industry to promote regional competitiveness has become a global agreement. This paper selects Hengshui city Hebei province of China as the case subject to study how to spur the economic development of small and medium-sized cities in China through education industry. On the basis of researching the role of education industry in regional economic development, using the method of empirical study, this paper takes deep-research on two aspects: one is the talent resource how to promote the rapid development of local economy, the other is to study the increasing consumption ability caused by education industry. Finally, directing at the actual developing situation of Hengshui education industry and economic, this paper gives relative policy recommendations.

Book Editors: Zhang, S; Feng, Z; Zhao, H; Zhang, H
Article Title: A Strategy Analysis on the Price Formation Mechanism of Coal Resources
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Coal Price; Formation Mechanism; Countermeasure
Abstract: China is a major producer and consumer of coal. However, coal price could not reflect market supply and demand perfectly under the interfere of government past years. The existing problems in the process of coal price formation are like not being able to reflect the scarcity of coal resources, the function overlapping of fees and taxes, not being able to compensate the destructive influence of production activities like coal mining and transportation on environment, underestimating the cost of ensuring safe production and educating as well as training. At the same time, the coal trade practices is pretty single, It helps neither the two-way expression of price attitude nor the formation of international power of discourse of China in coal commodity. We analyze the existing problem of price formation mechanism of coal in china and the inner reasons, propose relative policy proposals, believing that it is necessary to reform China's price formation mechanism of coal resources completely and build up a simple but reasonable one which is advantageous to coal effective utilization and government macro-control.

Article Title: The Status, Problems and Developing Strategies for Storage and Fresh-keeping of Fruits and Vegetables
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Fruits and Vegetables; Storage and Fresh-keeping; Status; Problem Strage
Abstract: This article in the brief introduction fruits and vegetables store maintain freshness in the industrial present situation foundation,elaborated the main problem of fruits and vegetables storage and fresh-keeping. after namely picked,commercialized processing consciousness light, lacking the facility;The storage and transportation maintaining freshness technology's promoted popular rate is low; Constructs the storehouse and the storehouse idle question blindly;Not yet establishes suits our country national condition, the science reasonable fruits and vegetables Intermediary organization and the sales network; Storage and fresh-keeping industry not to be able to meet the market economy developing. In view of the above question, had pointed out the fruits and vegetables storage and Fresh-keeping development main contermeasure including:Gradually consummation Intermediary organization and sales network; Further communication market information, strengthens the market system construction; Study and establish the suitable for China's national conditions of fruit processing system,Fully using social resource; Strengthen fresh-keeping technology application.

Book Editors: Zhang, S; Feng, Z; Zhao, H; Zhang, H
Article Title: Tradable Discharge Permits System for Water Pollution
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Emission Trading Program; Cost-effectiveness; Social Welfare Maximizing
Abstract: Water quality monitoring network design has historically tended to use experience, intuition and subjective judgment in locating monitoring stations. Better design procedures to optimize monitoring systems need to simultaneously identify significant planning objectives and consider a number of social, economic and environmental constraints. The consideration of multiple objectives may require further decision analysis to determine the preference weights associated with the objectives to aid in the decision-making process. This may require the application of an optimization study to extract such information from decision makers or experts and to evaluate the overall effectiveness of locating strategies. This paper raises a bran-new measure which is named as emission trading program to design the system of protecting the environment. The paper also introduces the building of emission trading program.

Article Title: Research on the Investment Funds of Chinese Inter-City Rail Transit Construction Systems Engineering
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Inter-city Rail Transit Engineering System; Inter-city Rail Transit Construction Investment Fund; Control Dispatch Center of Inter-city Rail Transit Network Construction and Operation
Abstract: In order to construct an urban integrated rail transit, the social funds should be driven by the government fiscal funds to build an investment and financing platform of fiscal/social funds to set up inter-city rail transit construction investment funds specially engaged in inter-city rail transit construction investment business to solve the huge capital gap excluding government investment and achieve the optimal allocation of social resources. It is not only providing a fast and effective investment and financing mode for building inter-city rail transit of city groups but also very beneficial to establish and perfect the capital market of social infrastructure industry at the macro level to implement and cooperate with government specific social macro-economic policy. We can build a control dispatch center of network project construction project operation management, and set up scheduling fund which ensures the network project construction and project operation management are in normal range. So the progress of all networks subprojects construction, the operation management of the project and its financial input and the controllable operation can be assured. Establish Settlement center, control dispatch center and database to considerate the capital investment, usage and withdrawal comprehensively. In this way, it can overcome the shortcomings of the dominant position of the indirect financing capital structural dominated by China's commercial banking system, the single investment /financing channel and the over-centralized financial capital structure.

Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom

Abstract: Comprehensive quality assessment of university graduates is an evaluation problem of multi-factor. And, graduates must be remarked the performance of the four academic years morally, intellectually, physically and so on. Therefore, the characteristics of comprehensive quality evaluation of college graduates are to consider many factors and cover a larger time span. In this article, the writer calculates a graduate's comprehensive performance in each academic year by using fuzzy mathematics principle and then takes the performance as results of expert's evaluation by using D-S evidence theory. Combined the evidence, four academic scores of comprehensive results can be obtained.

Article Title: Study on the Issue of Economic Transformation in Resource-exhausted Cities
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Resource-exhausted Cities; Economic Transformation; Issue
Abstract: The resource-dependent cities had made great and indelible achievements in economic development. After development for decades, threats of resource-exhausting have been gradually emerged. 426 resource-exhausted cities were produced, and plenty of strategic transformation issues are needed to be tackled. The essay analysed main features and current situations of resource-exhausted cities in China as well as main problems faced by resource-exhausted cities, such as the declining tendency of the dominant resource, the increases of exploitation at a staggering rate, Unreasonable industrial structure distribution, ignorance of the balanced development of other substitution industry and so on. This paper investigates the problems shown in the process of economic transformation and also provides an array of countermeasures, such as strengthening industrial restructure, selecting substitution industry, the formulation of appropriate financial aid policies for industry, rationally exploitation, improving social security system and maintaining social stability, establishing the compensation mechanism to promote sustainable development Asset-based city and so on.

Article Title: The Research on the Comprehensive Evaluating Index System of Campus Linear-Space in Universities
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: University Campus; Landscape Planning; AHP; Evaluation Model
Abstract: According to the spot investigation of campus linear-space programming status and development trend, three spatial conformation characteristics of the line form space layout have been found which are opening, humanity, and relevance. At the same time, 15 indexes have been determined by using the method of screening and expert inquiry. The evaluation model of the programming has also been established by using AHP (Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) and the key factors such as sub-road, main road, road node, landscape of teaching area, public area landscape and the teaching group of space have great influence on the line form space planning. In line with the study, the road axes are the important factors to mirror the role and status of the linear-space layouts in campus programming. Thus when we make a decision on campus linear space layout, we should consider road axes firstly, and next take into account the landscape axes.

Article Title: The Post-evaluation of Residential Real Estate Based on Entropy Fuzzy Comprehensive Evaluation
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Residential Real Estate; Post-evaluation; Entropy Weight; Fuzzy Comprehensive Evaluation
Abstract: As a part of the project management program, the post-evaluation of residential real estate project can draw experience and lessons after carrying on the overall summary and evaluation of the project. It can improve and enhance decision-making level and the investment income. According to project characteristics of residential real estate, a post-evaluation index system for residential real estate including the construction process, economic benefit and owner satisfaction index is offered. And the evaluation model is built by introducing principle of entropy into fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method. Objective weights are determined by properties of entropy method. It avoids the casualness of subjective weighting index in traditional evaluation model. Finally, an example shows that the evaluation result of evaluation model is scientific and reasonable.

Book Editors: Zhang, S; Feng, Z; Zhao, H; Zhang, H
Article Title: Expectation, Speculation and Urban Housing Price Volatility in China
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Rational Expectation; Adaptive Expectation; Speculation; Housing Price Volatility
Abstract: The paper incorporates expectation and speculation into a housing market equilibrium model to investigate the impact of expectation and speculation upon housing prices. The theoretical model illustrates that the higher is the rational expected housing price, the rampant is the speculation and the greater is the housing price volatility. However, the relation between adaptive expectation and the housing price volatility is complicated. The increase of the lagged housing price will give rise to the depreciation of current housing price, should the consumption demand dominates the aggregate demand. The increase of the lagged housing price, however, will lead to the escalation of current housing price provided that speculative demand dominates the aggregate demand. Using the data of 35 major cities in China from 1996 through 2007, the paper shows that expectation and its speculation are testified to have a greater influence on the housing price volatility. The other findings include: the role of the economic fundamentals is more important than that of the expectation, but it does not imply that the housing price volatilities in some cities will not derived from the expectation and speculation; the impact of the lagged housing price is greater than that of the forward housing price, which means the role of adaptive expectation is greater than that of rational expectation; the actual interest rate has the greatest impact on housing price volatility, which indicates that interest policies exacerbate housing price volatility; the role of household income is more significant than that of developing cost; the fast is the population growth, the greater is the housing price volatility, but the housing price volatility does not display a remarkable disparity across geographic locations.

Article Title: Simulation Research of Systematic Coordination of Sustainable Development in Resource-based Cities-A Case Study of Xuzhou
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Resource-based Cities; Sustainable Development; Systematic Coordination Simulation
Abstract: Because of exhaustibility and large-scale exploration of natural resources, some resource-based cities become mineral depleted and then city declined gradually. The development of these cities are not sustainable, their economy, society, resources and environment are not coordinated each other. In this paper, the author set up simulation model of system coordination of economy, society, resource and environment in resource-based cities according to the theme of city's sustainable development. Then, the effect of factors adjustment was discussed with Xuzhou city as an example including population policy, economy growth, mineral resources, ecological management. At last, some suggestions were proposed to promote the systematic coordination of Xuzhou's sustainable development. We hope this research can be adopted for reference by governments when they establish macroeconomic policies.

Article Title: Study on the Support of Science and Technology for International Service Outsourcing in Jilin Province
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: International Service Outsourcing; Science and Technology; Support; Jilin Province
Abstract: Science and technology can support for the development of international service outsourcing, and the support comes from the output of science and technology, the information transmission, the input of science and technology as well as the human resource. Based on the analysis on the support of science and technology for the international service outsourcing, this paper sets an indicator system. According to statistical data, the paper uses the principal component analysis to evaluate the support of science and technology for the development of international service outsourcing. It shows that the support is weak in Jilin province. In order to further develop the support of Science and Technology for International Service Outsourcing in Jilin province, the paper puts forward some measures, that is: to improve the input of science and technology, to train and introduce professionals, to build transformation mechanism from science and technology to productivity, to improve the level of information service.

Authors: Wang, YF; Ren, J; Zhang, XM
Book Editors: Zhang, S; Feng, Z; Zhao, H; Zhang, H
Author Full Names: Wang Yafei; Ren Jin; Zhang Xuemin
Article Title: Upgrading Strategies of Value Chain for Chinese Manufacturing Enterprises
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: In-product Value Chain Division of Labor; Upgrading; Path
Abstract: Under the background of economical globalization, the international division of labor boundary transferred into the in-product value chain division from simply industry division. On the ground of in-product value chain division of labor, because lacking of strategy on inserting high link of value chain and other essential factors, Chinese manufacturing industry enterprises lie in the low link of value chain. Along with the development of division in value chain, the status of Chinese manufacturing enterprises in global division becomes even worse. This paper tries to specify Chinese manufacturing enterprises' status in value chain on the ground of in-product value chain division. In addition, referencing those theories and practice on value chain upgrading, this paper studies intensively on the multiple upgrading path of Chinese manufacturing enterprises and proposes the trinity strategy ---- at the enterprise level, industry cluster level and national level.

Abstract: In the framework of the China - ASEAN Free Trade Area, Nan (Ning)Gui(Zhou)Kun(Ming) region is facing unprecedented development opportunities, so they take steps to maximize the economic and trade cooperation with the Association of Southeast Asian Nations. As the influence by some factors, such as social and historical, geographical environment, national policy guidance and some problems inherent in NanGuiKun, NanGuiKun's game activities in trade with ASEAN cooperation result in NanGuiKun regional industrial structure was a low phenomenon. This paper analyze the problem of low level of industry structure of NGK from the perspective of game theory. To explain the reason of low level of industry structure with non-cooperative game theory, and guide the industrial structure adjustment of NanGuiKun with cooperative game theory. The target is to prompt resources reasonable allocated between the whole region, improve the low level of regional industry structure, and ultimately realize the Pareto overall the NanGuiKun region.

Article Title: Research on System Construction of Product Cost Calculation and Management with Anti-dumping Orientation in Chinese Enterprises
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Anti-dumping Orientation; Cost Calculation and Management; System; Construction
Abstract: An important phenomenon can always be found that when Chinese enterprises respond to anti-dumping, the rate of winning the case is low. The important reason is lack of effective support of accounting information. This article researches anti-dumping from the perspective of product cost, and analyses the important role of cost calculation and management in response to anti-dumping. This article suggests constructing the anti-dumping oriented system of cost calculation and management to help Chinese enterprises respond to anti-dumping.

Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom

Abstract: In this paper, the basic ideas proposed by Central China, namely, the eastern manufacturing, the creation of the central and western recycling. Shows that the rise of the central region lies in vigorously promoting technological innovation, taking an innovative path of economic development in central region, the inevitable choice. A detailed analysis of what is innovation-based economy, as well as the main features of innovation-based economy, pointing out that innovation-based economic growth and innovative economic development of the difference. It then analyzes the six provinces in central status of an innovative economic development, and finally how to develop innovation-based economy from the point of view, for the innovative direction of economic development put forward some concrete suggestions for the development of relevant policy departments as a reference.

Author Full Names: Sun Yu; Yao Xiaodong; Delapierre, Michel
Article Title: Globalisation, Emergence of International Production Networks and the Increasing Need for Information Services
Source Title: ADVANCES IN MANAGEMENT OF TECHNOLOGY, PT 1
Conference Title: 5th International Conference on Management of Technology
Conference Sponsor: Shanxi Assoc Risk Management,N Univ China,Shanxi Univ Finance & Econom
Author Keywords: Globalisation; Production Network; Information System
Abstract: Globalisation induces the formation of international production networks (IPNs), led by large multinationals. These networks need a vast array of specialised services offered internally as well as by third-party suppliers, leading to the emergence of several business services segments, which opens opportunities for the building of local enterprises. There is then an increasing need to collect, compute and exploit at the maximum speed possible an ever growing amount of information and knowledge. This requires specific skills, specialised departments which can be provided in house or externalised and bought from independent suppliers, locally or offshore.

Article Title: Analysis to Cultivating Rural Area Consumer Market and Expand the in the Homeland Consumer Demand
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Confeence on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: Rural area consumer market; Economic growth; Reason; Countermeasure
Abstract: Rural area consumer market scale has decided it has irreplaceable important position in national economy. There is huge potential consumer market in China's rural areas. Nurturing the rural consumer market is the realization of China's economic growth pattern, and to maintain the great engine of economic growth. China's consumer market in rural areas, the basic situation is the low level of overall consumption and consumption structure is irrational. Foster rural consumer market, through adjusting and optimizing the agricultural structure, increasing investment in agriculture and promote agro-processing industry scale rural development approach to increase farmer's income and increase their purchasing power. Through rural infrastructure, expanding rural commercial network, increase the intensity of rural financial services, improve the consumption environment in rural areas. Establish and perfect the social security system and improve confidence in consumer spending in rural areas.

Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Confeence on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: Competency; Small-and-medium-sized enterprises; Managers; Analysis of Variance
Abstract: This paper aims to discover the current situation of on-the-job managers, find factors influencing the competency of managers in small-and-medium-sized enterprises. Using research methods of literature analysis, qualitative & quantitative research, this paper carries out empirical study on the competency of small-and-medium-sized enterprises with the adoption of behavior event interview (BEI), checklist and factor analysis. Several crucial conclusions are drawn as follows: namely, power of influence, planning ability, organizational perceptivity, self-confidence, organizational commitment, foresight, group leadership, profession, decision making, continuous improvement, introspectiveness, self-control and information feedback.

Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Conference on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: human resource management; electronic resumes; analytic hierarchy process (AHP); automatic resume filter
Abstract: In this paper, we present a model of automatic electronic resume filter system. As information technology development, online recruitment, online resume posting are more and more popular. To filter satisfying resumes among a lot of electronic resumes effectively, this paper applies the method of analytic hierarchy process to design electronic resume filter model and evaluation way of basic criteria. We recommend the automatic resume filter system; the result demonstrates the effectiveness of it.

Article Title: Analysis of the Land Use Types of Haizhu District, Guangzhou Province by VCM and Correlation Based on Traffic Network
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Conference on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: traffic network; Land use type; Variable Clumping Method; Haizhu district
Abstract: The paper analyzed the land use types of Haizhu District, Guangzhou Province by VCM and correlation based on traffic network. The results include: All the land use types were aggregated by traffic network but their aggregation were different. The mining land showed greatest aggregation than other land use types because all enterprises reduced the production costs of traffic by built the factory near the roads. The residential area land showed greater aggregation than cultivated land and garden land because it was convenient for transportation. All land use types showed great correlation with each other in the buffer of variable clumping.

Author Keywords: Developing economies; knowledge management; educational institutions; Pakistan
Abstract: The rapidly expanding use of technology in teaching and learning, and the transformed economic basis upon which universities are instituted, have caused universities to transform the ways in which knowledge is produced, stored, disseminated, and authorized. Knowledge is at the heart of much of today's global economy and managing knowledge has become vital to companies success. In the paper we focus on bringing some arguments that proper knowledge management is not only uplift the standards of universities in Pakistan but also essential for the better performance of industries, which definitely improve the economy of a country.

Article Title: The Study of Project Cost Management Base on the Whole Procedure Control
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Conference on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: Project Cost Management; Procedure; VE
Abstract: In project construction process, cost control with quality and schedule control stands at the center of project management. Project cost control should start from offer of the project bid to the settlement when the project is completed, run through the whole process of project implementation. The level of cost management will directly determine the effect of cost control. In this paper, basic procedure of project cost management is systematically analyzed, including the detailed analysis of cost plan, cost accounting, cost analysis and cost assessment, etc. This paper focuses on the concrete methods of cost control and cost analysis with some project cases.

Article Title: An Economic Study of Construction Safety
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Confeence on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: construction safety; economics; general equilibrium theory; game theory
Abstract: The construction industry is one pillar of our national economy, and play an important role on development of China's economic, but construction safety is not optimistic. Accidents about construction brought huge economic losses, and it also resulted in adverse social impact, in particular, casualties and losses were irreversible. Construction safety is the important guarantee for builders, and it is a great significance for healthy and stable development of the construction company and national economy. This article has used general equilibrium theory and game theory to analyze it from economic. view, found out the reasons of bad construction security situation, then give some proposes which to improve building safeguards system and the actuality of construction safety.

Article Title: Research on the Risk Management of Auditor-Evidence from the Listed Companies of Restatement in China
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Conference on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: Restatement; Risk Management; Auditor
Abstract: This study want to research the risk management of auditor. Because restatement means listed companies possibly has risk, we think auditors will implement the risk management. The result shows auditors increase the audit fees of listed companies which disclose restatement significantly. And auditors pay more attention to the restatement caused by fraud. Furthermore the risk management of auditor to the restatement caused by fraud is much greater that the others. The results indicate that the risk management of auditor is very effective.

Article Title: Study on Construction of Film Core Product Based on Marketing Perspective
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Confeence on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: marketing perspective; film core product; construction
Abstract: From the marketing perspective, the film product also includes five levels: core product, form product, expected product, additional product and potential product. The overall concept of film product built up according to level of films enables producers of the film products to rationally analyze the consumer demand of different levels so as to identify the core needs to determine the competition priorities. The first consideration of movie product marketing is how to allow consumers to get into the theater to obtain the satisfied core interests. The construction of the film core products from the marketing perspective includes the works of three aspects: scientific market survey, mining national culture and absorbing the resources from other cultural products.

Abstract: This paper has fully considered that core competitiveness in construction enterprises must include two attributes: importance and diversity, therefore, a method, at the first using BP neural network to analyze the importance of competitive index and then calculating the information entropy to make an analysis of diversity of competitive index, is adopted to get a core-competitive index for a construction enterprise. This way is aim to build a construction enterprise core competitiveness identification table, through which enterprises will recognize self-core-competitiveness and make out their own developmental strategies by filling data in this table.

Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing

Abstract: Innovative city has been an international popular topic in recent 30 years which has strategic meanings to the national and exotic economics, social and regional development. This kind of research has been focal point nowadays. In this paper, the author use the past research on international innovative city for reference, trying to find the orientation of Tianjin Binhai New Area on the innovative city construction, master the foreground of the innovative city construction in Tianjin Binhai New Area, and eventually giving some suggestions on the construction framework of Innovative city in Tianjin Binhai New Area.

Article Title: Sensitivity Analysis on Invisible Demand of Insurance Products
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Confeence on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: invisible demand; insurance products; regression analysis; correlation analysis
Abstract: On the background of studying invisible demand deeply, we draw on the different research areas of invisible demand from the relevant researches of domestic and foreign scholars. In this paper we analyze the comparative difference between insurance products and tangible products from the three perspectives, flexibility and ambiguity and synchronization, highlighting the invisible of insurance products. We then do the correlation analysis and the regression analysis between insurance products and income and consumption. We find that people often tends to keep the consumption of insurance products with income rising, owing to revenue reaching a certain level and avoiding to the desire risk stronger. Finally, new insurance products based on invisible demand will be produced to meet people's demand continuously.

Article Title: Knowledge and Information Technology and Urban (Regional) Development
Source Title: MICBE '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 10TH WSEAS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MATHEMATICS AND COMPUTERS IN BUSINESS AND ECONOMICS
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: 10th WSEAS International Conference on Mathematics and Computers in Business and Economics
Conference Sponsor: WSEAS
Author Keywords: Knowledge economy; Knowledge-based development; Information technology; Regions; Cities
Abstract: Knowledge and learning, as the major processes of 'knowledge production', are often cited as ultimate sources of competitive advantage, due to the special characteristics, arising from the analysis of knowledge as an economic factor. In this paper/speech, linkage is made between the well-described theories of knowledge-based companies (economies) and the spatial proximity, facilitated by the relevant urban/region policies. In addition, the theoretical determinants of such a 'knowledge city' ('knowledge region') are placed within the wider context of innovation, with the specific linkage to the idea of habitus, as elaborated by Bourdieu in the field of sociology.

Article Title: M-applications Development using High Performance Project Management Techniques
Source Title: MICBE '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 10TH WSEAS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MATHEMATICS AND COMPUTERS IN BUSINESS AND ECONOMICS
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: 10th WSEAS International Conference on Mathematics and Computers in Business and Economics
Conference Sponsor: WSEAS
Author Keywords: Mobile applications; Mobile devices; Project management; Performance metrics
Abstract: This paper analyses the specifics of m-applications development projects. Even though m-application development projects have their particular features and need customized approaches, still we find that legacy and proven best practices project management techniques can be successfully employed. We present two proven software project management techniques that were successfully adapted to the development of m-applications. One is the estimation of m-application project duration using top-down and bottom-up approaches. The other is the use of a set of performance metrics for project quality assessment.

Abstract: The asssembling ability evaluating for virtual maintenance system of components can be viewed as a problem of the multi-level fuzzy comprehensive evaluation which should be divided into different layers based on its attributes and employ it to evaluation. Therefore, a new system is found to evaluate this kind of problems base on the knowledge of fuzzy mathematics to explore the fuzzy comprehensive evaluation of the theory and method, then establishs the mathematical model of collaborative design can be assembled on multilevel fuzzy evaluation. Finally, an example of collaborative design for fuzzy evaluation to understand the mathematical model.

Article Title: Investigation on the business ability testing status of some Zhengzhou university PE teachers under the appointment system
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Confeence on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: PE teachers; business ability; testing status
Abstract: To comprehend the status and problems existed in university P.E. teachers appointment system,then set up scientific and comprehensive performance testing mechanism and discover a set of effective university P.E. teachers appointment administration system, this research takes documentary,interview investigation,statistics collection to study,then founds that most Zhengzhou university P.E. teachers thought the annual business test only had a simple form and did not have the clear testing content and standard,test results were unreal and the utilization level of test results was low. It leads to the fact that individual report on his work was various,the testing team did not have a unified testing standard and the standard stress more on quality but less on quantity. It is suggested that the modem university P.E. teachers testing contents should be made basing on reality scientificly and rationally. The testing contents should stress both on performance and teachers' potential which representing university's basic demands for teachers. Whether the content is rational determines the quality of teachers'evaluation. Full P.E. teachers evaluation should include performance evaluation,ability evaluation,attitude evaluation and potential evaluation.

Abstract: The implicit quality cost of construction project will be mainly analyzed in the paper from two steps by taking advantage of Taguchi method: One involves establishment of implicit quality loss function so as to determine the standards of implicit quality loss evaluation. The other involves method choice of cost estimation in order to visualize the implicit quality cost. Thus, the implicit quality cost will be estimated successfully. By throwing a sprat to catch a whale, the paper aims at obtaining more concerns and inspiration of quality cost estimation from managers and researchers.

Abstract: SWOT analysis is commonly used in corporate strategic choice of a method, but this method which is used in the construction industry is still limited to qualitative analysis, with some limitations. The analytic hierarchy process (AHP) was used into the strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats (SWOT) analysis so as to make up China construction enterprise development strategies.

It is necessary to set up the new type of Rural Financial Institutions to push the ecological economic construction. The favorable policy and the better financial environment produce the a good living and development space for the Village and Town Bank. Article Title: The Analysis of the Role that the Mass Media Plays in Solving Public Crisis
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Confeence on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: mass media; public crisis; role; analysis
Abstract: Nothing can be more serious than the public is kept in the dark about the truth. The occurrence of public crisis is inevitable with the rapid development of economy and science and with the deepening of social reforms. Because of the important role mass media plays in allowing information disclosure and transparency, it is necessary for mass media to shoulder its own responsibility in crisis management. With some sudden events of public crisis, this article tracks out that mass media should be the watchmen of society for telling people the sudden events fully and strictly according to the facts. It should also be the communicator between the government and public and be the guide of public opinions. On the other hand, it should help the government find solutions, mobilize the public and supervise the course of implementation.

Conference Title: 1st Conference on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing

Abstract: Various risks will occur inevitably in the deep excavation engineering, because of its complexity anduncertainty including natural and man-made factors, which go throughout the whole course of design, construction and management. Therefore, it is more important for risk identification and management. In the paper, Fault Tree Analysis method on Human Errors is used in identifying risk factors in deep foundation engineering, dynamic riskmanagement on risk tracking and risk early warning is put forward.

Article Title: Research on Critical Factors of Online Consume Decision-Making Based on R-System Clustering
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Confeence on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: on-line consume decision-making; critical factors; data mining; R-system clustering
Abstract: With the development of electronic commerce, the factors affecting on-line consume decision-making are becoming more complex. In allusion to the few researchs on the critical factors affecting on-line consume decision-making. It's quite significant to find out the critical factors of on-line consume decision-making because the Internet shopkeepers can sell more goods by improving those critical factors. Firstly, 47 general factors affecting on-line consume decision-making are sorted out in this paper through literature review combining with some experiences of some successful e-commerce websites. Then, R-system clustering algorithm was applied and finally 17 critial factors affecting on-line consume decision-making were extracted from these general factors, which provides some references for improving online business operation of enterprise.

Abstract: Information is the life-blood of the travel industry, and that ITCs (Information and communication technologies- the hardware, software and netware used by informaion system) are becoming the information, communication and operation backbone of tourism. ITCs are driving the emerging globalization of tourism demand and supply. They provide effective tools both to consumers for identifying and purchasing suitable products and to suppliers for developing, managing and distributing their offering on a global scale. ITCs therefore become an imperative partner and they increasingly determine the interface between consumers and suppliers as well as the ability of the industry to develop, manage and market suitable tourism products globally.

Article Title: The Extended of the Life Cycle Assessment on Corporate Environmental Performance

Conference Title: 1st Conference on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: corporate environmental performance; sustainable development; life cycle assessment
Abstract: This paper attempts to extend the corporate social responsibility in environmental dimensions. The objective of the paper is to suggest an improvement of the most commonly used corporate environmental management tool the Life Cycle Assessment (LCA). The current study includes two stages. First, more phases are added to the life cycle of a product. Second, some criteria that measure the investment in environmental protection are introduced. Moreover, upstream and downstream firms are considered in the assessment of environmental performance to extend the LAC further.

Abstract: In the new wave of global information technology, software and service outsourcing industry has won attention at home and abroad. Firstly, we analyzed of the status quo of Dalian software and service outsourcing industry, and the main problems in the development. Secondly, we proposed several development strategies to promote the rapid and all-round development of Dalian software and service outsourcing industry, which were export in European and American markets, increasing efforts to introducing and training talents, strengthening the cluster effects of the software zone, widening financing channels and so on.

Author Keywords: SME; Financing risk; Countermeasure
Abstract: Financing for a business is crucial, is the starting point for production and operation activities. Enterprises in the financing process are facing a variety of risks, the major causes of which are the external environment factors and internal management reasons. The paper analyzes the causes of Small and Medium-sized Enterprise (SME) financing risks and puts forward some measures that should be adopted by the Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) to deal with financing risks.

Article Title: The Influence of Categorical/Relational Thinking on Brand Extension Evaluation
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Conference on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: brand extension; attribute; relation
Abstract: Brand extension is a marketing strategy in which a firm extends from an old product category into a different new product category with the same brand name. This paper finds that if two product categories, X and Y, have common attributes but different usages, then for those tends to group objects according to their attributes, there is no significant difference in brand extension evaluations regardless of whether X extends to Y or the reverse; but for those tends to group objects according to their relations, extension direction has a significant effect on brand extension evaluations.

Article Title: Quantitative Risk Research of Multimodal Transport of Goods
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Conference on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: multimodal transport; risk analysis; analytic hierarchy process (AHP); entropy weight method; fuzzy comprehensive evaluation method
Abstract: The emergence of inter-modal transport modes is the third revolution in the transport industry, it makes the transport process more rational and more efficient. However, because of the combination of different transport modes, the transportation risk is inevitably. In this paper, the author proposes a risk analysis method of multi-modal based on the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AMP) and entropy weight method. First, the author determines the weight throughout the method of Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) and entropy weight method, and finally evaluates the risk factors making use of fuzzy comprehensive, and determines the risk rating.

Article Title: Can Product Market Competition Substitute Internal Governance Structure?
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Conference on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: product market competition; corporate governance; overinvestment; non-efficient-investment
Abstract: Prior studies have shown that product market competition reduces the managers' slack and internal governance structure prevents managers from moral hazards. However, there are few studies on the joint effect of product market competition and internal governance structure on companies' over-investments. This paper studies the interaction of product market competition and internal governance structure on restraining companies' over-investments. We think that the more efficient the board, the less the company over-invests, but it is not the case according to the entire internal governance structure formed by board governance and stockholders governance. And the paper also shows complemented effects of product market competition and internal governance structure on companies' over-investments.

Article Title: The Study on Sustainability of the Project of Returning Farmland to Forest-A Case Study of the Project of Returning Farmland to Forest of Zhijin County in Guizhou Province
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Conference on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: Zhijin county; the Cropland Conversion Program; Sustainability assessment; AHP
Abstract: Based on understanding the meaning to Sustainability of the Cropland Conversion Program, a set of indicators has been developed for assessing Sustainability of the Cropland Conversion Program from capacity of the stability, dynamic traction and support the basis of the three subsystems; Zhijin county in Guizhou province was taken as an example, and assessments were conducted of Sustainability of the Program by means of analytic hierarchy process; Its result was showed that the Sustainability of the program was in weak sustainability, Among them, stability sub-system is at the level of the weak sustainability, traction power sub-system is at the level of weak sustainability, the support of the basis sub-system is at the level of non- sustainability; Some countermeasures were put forward to promote Sustainability of the program by identifying social factors affecting the effectiveness and sustainability of the program.

Article Title: Exploratory Study on IT Outsourcing
Source Title: MICBE '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 10TH WSEAS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MATHEMATICS AND COMPUTERS IN BUSINESS AND ECONOMICS
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: 10th WSEAS International Conference on Mathematics and Computers in Business and Economics
Conference Sponsor: WSEAS
Author Keywords: IT outsourcing; Initial Review; Tender Evaluation; Contract Management; Project Roll-on
Abstract: The Kodak Effect has motivated many organizations to involve in IT outsourcing. Entering its maturity level, still IT outsourcing is not without problems. Therefore, there have been many researches that suggest the guidelines of managing IT outsourcing activities. Still, there is a need to explore what is currently being a practice so as to identify the weaknesses and vulnerabilities. In order to achieve the objective, exploratory, qualitative research method was used in this study. Nine organizations were selected as a sample. The result of the research shows that even though there are proper guidelines available, some of the organizations omit some important steps. As a consequence, some organizations encountered difficulty in managing their projects. For future works, the weaknesses and vulnerability of current practices will then be enhanced and a framework for managing IT Outsourcing will then be proposed.

Authors: Khan, HU; Ullah, Z; Mahmud, M

Author Full Names: Khan, Hameed Ullah; Ullah, Zahid; Mahmud, Maqsood
Article Title: Micro Business of Currency Conversion using Data Mining Techniques
Source Title: MICBE '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 10TH WSEAS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MATHEMATICS AND COMPUTERS IN BUSINESS AND ECONOMICS
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: 10th WSEAS International Conference on Mathematics and Computers in Business and Economics
Conference Sponsor: WSEAS
Author Keywords: Microfinance; Currency Conversion; Data mining; decision graph
Abstract: Microfinance business is a prevailing business in third world countries and proves beneficial to improve economies of the country. In our paper we conceived and designed some algorithms by using data mining techniques to have general micro currency exchange businesses for a developing country. Our algorithm process two years historical records of currency rates and applies data mining techniques i.e. Median Method and Rise & Fall Method with probabilistic approach conceived by us. It can apply to N year's data with unless desired results are achieved. This is to give best choice to micro currency business men to take decision to buy or sell currency. Some previous currency rates (i.e. Ups & Down) are also recorded from a popular bank of Canada & currency open markets as a proof of concept using our algorithm. Our algorithm can be efficiently used by all those who wish to initialize a small business (Cottage Industries) with a profitable income with less investment. We guarantee them to successfully launch their businesses with trust and courage.

Article Title: Innovative Analysis of a CRM Database using Online Analytical Processing (OLAP) Technique in Value Chain Management Approach
Source Title: MICBE '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 10TH WSEAS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MATHEMATICS AND COMPUTERS IN BUSINESS AND ECONOMICS

Conference Title: 10th WSEAS International Conference on Mathematics and Computers in Business and Economics

Author Keywords: CRM; online analytical processing; information and communication technologies; branding; logistics
Abstract: In this paper, we emphasize the main capabilities of a CRM software, which integrates three aspects that provide value chain sustainability: operational (marketing and sales automation), collaborative (the relationships between companies' representatives and customers) and analytical (the opportunity to apply OLAP technique on CRM system variables). The multidimensional analysis applied to the information gathered on CRM database provides a real support in view to make an efficient decision by the managers that are responsible for the business development, centered on profitable customers. The OLAP technique emphasizes the interdependences between the different variables of CRM system in order to value the information about customers, which represents the digital gold in the e-business approach.

Article Title: On the Bending of Carbon Nanotubes
Source Title: MICBE '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 10TH WSEAS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MATHEMATICS AND COMPUTERS IN BUSINESS AND ECONOMICS
Book Series Title: Recent Advances in Computer Engineering
Conference Title: 10th WSEAS International Conference on Mathematics and Computers in Business and Economics
Conference Sponsor: WSEAS
Author Keywords: Carbon nanotube; bending; solitons; Van der Waals force; stability
Abstract: In this paper, the bending of nanotubes of carbon is analyzed. By coupling the continuum theory with molecular dynamic theory, it results a new method based on a deformation solitonic mechanism model. This model explains the high strength of nanotubes in bending. When the external bending moment increases, the axial compression in the tube increases too, and when the compressive stress reaches a critical value, the tube will locally buckle with the bending angle at 25.58 degrees. Above of this value, a solitonic deformation mechanism is starting and a portion of the nanotube becomes to rotate about a central hinge line. For large distances, the van der Waals force is attractive, but when the separation between the atoms is below the equilibrium distance of 3.42 angstrom, it becomes strongly repulsive. Upon complete unloading from angles below 110 degrees the nanotube completely recovers. At a very large bending angle of 120 degrees, atomic bonds break and the deformation of the nanotube becomes irreversible. This research is useful to explore the creation of new nano-composites that utilize carbon nanotubes, from the point of view of construction optimization.

Source Title: MICBE '09: PROCEEDINGS OF THE 10TH WSEAS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON MATHEMATICS AND COMPUTERS IN BUSINESS AND ECONOMICS

Conference Title: 10th WSEAS International Conference on Mathematics and Computers in Business and Economics
Conference Sponsor: WSEAS
Author Keywords: IS-LM model; tax revenues; Neimark-Sacker bifurcation
Abstract: In this paper, we study a discrete IS-LM model with tax revenues. Considering its parameters as variables, we analyze the existence of the Neimark-Sacker bifurcation. We find the normal form and its Lyapunov coefficient. Finally, using a program in Maple I I we make some numerical simulations that verify the theoretical results.

Article Title: Study on Relationship between Job Satisfaction and Performance of Apparel Foreign Trade Enterprises
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Confeence on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: apparel foreign-trade enterprise; employee satisfaction; employee loyalty; employee engagement; job performance; SEM (Structural Equation Model)
Abstract: With the related theoretical study, regarding to the importance of employee satisfaction, loyalty and the relationships among them, a Structural Equation Model (SEM) was used in this paper to indicate the relationship among factors which affect employee satisfaction and the relationship among employee satisfaction, loyalty, engagement and job performance were put forward. After collected the questionnaires which were sent out, we used the LISREL software to explore the relationship between the factors influencing employee satisfaction and validate the rationality and applicability. Then the final model of factors influencing the job satisfaction and the model of relationship between various factors were got. At the end of this paper some human resource management proposals to increase employee job performance is raised.

Article Title: Research on Innovative Ways of Rural Financial Services
Source Title: CONFERENCE ON WEB BASED BUSINESS MANAGEMENT, VOLS 1-2
Conference Title: 1st Confeence on Web Based Business Management
Conference Sponsor: Zhejiang Univ,Wuhan Univ,James Madison Univ,Sci Res Publishing
Author Keywords: Rural Finance; Countermeasure; Innovation
Abstract: The development of modern agriculture has given rural finance an enormous market potential. Construction of new socialist countryside can not do without the financial support. Monopoly causes the Innovation in rural financial markets lack of motivation, Imperfect rural financial system, facilities and policies restricting the function of rural financial play. Lack of rural financial services can not meet the financial needs of rural. In rural areas, lack of appropriate compensation mechanism, weakened financial institutions active in rural areas. Countries should deepen rural financial reforms to encourage private capital participation in rural finance. Leverage financial resources to play the role of policies to support the implementation of market access. Speed up construction of rural finance to change the traditional way of financial services. Simplify the process of financial services. Accelerate rural financial market security system.
