Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: university library; journal; Public bidding
Abstract: Based on journal's characteristics, the article analyzed the time period of foreign journals' purchasing job and compared the government procurement in university libraries with the previews methods. It also puts forward the improvement measures on the basis of practical experience, such as differentiating the procurement of periodicals from books and highlighting its own characteristics in technical requirements and assessment criteria,to ensure the smooth implementation of funds and continually procurement of library journals.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Global Convergence of the Modified CD Nonlinear Conjugate Gradient Method With Sufficient Descent Property
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: unconstrained optimization; conjugate gradient method
Abstract: In this paper, a little modification to the conjugate descent (CD) method is taken so that the direction generated by the modified method can satisfy, sufficient descent condition which is independent of any line search used. Moreover, the modified method reduces to the standard CD method if line search is exact. Under some mild conditions, it's proved that the modified method with Armijo line search is globally convergent even if the objective function is nonconvex. Beside, some numerical results are presented to show the efficiency of the proposed method.

Authors: Yi, XY; Zhang, ZQ; Wang, Q
Book Editors: Qi, JX
Author Full Names: Yi Xiaoyu; Zhang Zhaoqing; Wang Qiang
Article Title: Research on Comprehensive Quality Evaluation Model for Postgraduates
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Comprehensive quality evaluation; Support vector machine; Principle component analysis
Abstract: As the quntity of postgratuated students increased, their comprehensive quality is becoming more and more important to the employers and universities. In the traditional evaluation method, the evaluation indexes are numerous. In this paper, the method of principle component analysis is used to select the main index. Finally an evaluation model based on support vector machine is established because of its good properties such as automatic selection on models, being trained with quadratic programming and good learning ability for small samples,. Practical examples show that this method outperforms others in the respect of evaluation accuracy The results from this study demonstrate that the SVM gives consistently better classification results as compared with other methods.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Dynamic Integrated Assessment Study on the Effect of Construction Project Management
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: construction project; management effectiveness; dynamic comprehensive evaluation; linear weight aggregation function model; vertical Scatter Analysis
Abstract: Aiming at dynamic comprehensive evaluation problem of the construction project management effect, This paper selects the weight linear function model and uses vertical Scatter analysis method to give an dynamic comprehensive evaluation on the effect of construction project management. The weight coefficients of Vertical Scatter analysis, impling time weight vector are determined by the timing data table, which can avoid the distortion of the evaluation results caused by the error of coefficient data at some point and make the comprehensive evaluation results more reasonable. Finally, taking a specific project case which has been run for 10 months as an example, this paper dynamically and comprehensively evaluates the running effect. The results show that the vertical Scatter analysis method is not only reasonable, but also simple and practical, and could be helpful for the policy makers to analyze.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Theory and Method for Simplification of Large Type Time-cost Network with Safety Float
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: project management; time-cost tradeoff problem (TCTP); equivalent sub-network; Safety Float
Abstract: In this paper, we address the problem on simplification of large type time-cost network. Safety float is considered separate from total float, and the objective is to minimize total completion time. In order to give out the method of compressing total duration of large and mega time-cost network to equivalent sub-networks, we take advantage of property of safety float in the network. Firstly, we provide the algorithm of the parameter of nodes and activities in the network. Secondly, based on the algorithm of the parameters of nodes and activities, we address basic concepts and signals including Path, Safety Float, Safety Float of the Path etc. Thirdly, the correlation between safety float of activity and its length of path is studied to deduce Path Length Theory and Back-Main Chain Theory. Furthermore, other theories about safety float are deduced. At last, these theories are then applied to work out a simple method to find equivalent sub-network of large type network.

Authors: Zhang, ZP; Zhang, X; Wen, BY
Book Editors: Qi, JX
Author Full Names: Zhang Zi-Peng; Zhang Xiao; Wen Bi-Yan
Article Title: Study on Consumer Complaint of Service Failure - Base on the Analysis of Critical Incident Technique
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Consumer Complaint; Service Failure; Critical Incident Technique
Abstract: Consumer complaints caused by service failures are inevitable in service industry. This paper is the first to categorize and analyze different kinds of service failure which make consumer complain directly to the service providers in service industry using Critical Incident Technique (CIT). The following conclusions were drawn from the findings of this study: (1) Service failures of customer's complaint could be divided into three main groups: failure of service delivery system, failure of employees' attitude/responsibility and failure of employees' response and professional. (2) Employees' bad service attitude (28.5%) is the number one reason that makes consumers voices their complaint actively to the service provider. Managerial implication was discussed based on the research.

Article Title: Research on Service Chain Coordination Mechanism in Service Oriented Manufacturing
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: service outsourcing; service capacity; Stochastic service demand; product service-oriented supply chain
Abstract: This paper studies a three-echelon product Service-oriented supply chain consisting of a specialized service function provider, service integrator and customers. Service integrator who is faced with a price sensitive stochastic demand market purchases service capacity from specialized service function provider and sells the added service to customer The purpose of service integrator is to meet expected profit maximization through the optimal service capacity order quantity and price of integrated services. Specialized functions service provider identifies the best service capacity price to maximize the expected profit. This paper establishes revenue model and supply chain coordination mechanism model in product Service-oriented supply chain based on service capacity. Through the numerical examples, we find service capability has an important influence on product Service-oriented supply chain coordination performance.

Article Title: Research on Bottleneck in the Development of Small-scaled Shoemaking Enterprises with Interpretative Structural Modeling Method
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Shoemaking enterprises; interpretative structural model; industrial engineering
Abstract: The restriction of bottlenecks in small-scale enterprises constantly appears in the scale, standardization, branding etc. The problem of how to make small-scale enterprises develop in healthy and quick way is expected to be solved. This problem has become the common problem in the optimistic development to China's medium and small-scaled industry besides being the development problem in the leading industries in that region. On the basis of present status of the small-scaled shoemaking enterprises in a certain industrial area, this paper analyzes the reasons for the low level of the small-scaled shoemaking enterprises by using interpretative structural modeling method in industrial engineering and the corresponding improvement measures which are expected to achieve the aim of solving both manifestation and root cause of problem.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: The Problem of SPM Network Planning Model for Solving the Secondary Shortest Path of Directed Graph
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: operations research; SPM network planning; quasi-feature line method; CPM network planning
Abstract: The concepts of shortest path method (SPM) network planning, quasi-float parameters and quasi-critical path are proposed in this paper for the schedule that doesn't have strict predecessor and successor relationship between activities (any activity will be started as long as one of its predecessor activities to be finished), which is based on Dijkstra algorithm and the principle of CPM. The model was established; the nature of the model was analyzed; and the computational formula of quasi-float time was given. Then for the shortest path and secondary shortest path problems of the directed graph, the paper summarized the theorems and corollaries related to path-length of routes, which were analyzed by the theorem and nature of SPM Network planning model. And on this basis, the quasi-feature line method is proposed to solve such problems, and the correctness of the algorithm was analyzed. Finally, it was validated by example.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: A New Algorithm for Solving the Second Shortest Path in Directional Graph
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Graph theory; the second shortest path; character path algorithm; CPM network planning
Abstract: CPM network planning model is adapt to analyze schedule plan with strict immediate predecessor and successor restriction, viz, any activity could start only when its all immediate predecessor activities have finished, and using the model could find out the longest path in directional graph. According to the property of CPM network planning, and aiming at the shortest and the second shortest path problem, firstly, by analyzing properties of path length and floats in CPM network planning and extending the CPM network planning model, various CPM network planning model is founded which is corresponding to the CPM network model; secondly, by analyzing properties of the new model, new algorithm named character path algorithm is designed to solve the shortest and the second shortest path problem, and correctness of the algorithm is analyzed; and finally, illustration is used to validate the algorithm, which shows that the algprothm is effective and simple to solve the shortest and the second shortest path problem.

Article Title: Overall Planning for Integration and Optimization of Educational Resources-Perspective Balanced Development of Education in the Game of Chess
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: education balanced; educational resources; Overall planning; optimization
Abstract: Education is the rejuvenation of the foundation, but owing to historical and practical reasons, our education development is the unbalanced. accompanied by economic development, social progress and sound legal system, especially the law and the rights of the people, the problem of concern for education has been noticeably improved In this context, according to the requirement of the scientific development concept and the objective laws of education development education realized the balanced development of Chinese education policy will become the important subject of study. The investigation on the basis of commonness and difference objectively, summarizes some of the balanced development of education in China, and put forward the overall education resources, optimize the feasible measures for education development. Currently, education balanced development is moving from extended development to content development, in order to promote balanced development of educational resources, the key is in integrating educational resources, relying on structural optimization, resource sharing, increased efficiency and system security.

Article Title: Power Energy Efficiency in Coastal China
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Power energy efficiency; Coastal regions; DEA-CRS
Abstract: The paper is based on the data envelopment analysis of constant returns to scale(DEA-CRS) and evaluate the power energy efficiency of China's coastal provinces and regions from 1995 to 2008.It reveals that the regional differences of power energy efficiency in China. Yangtze River Delta has the highest efficiency score followed by Pearl River Delta. The power energy efficiency of Bohai Sea Delta is lowest among the three delta. This provides a basis for the theoretical study and the improvement power energy efficiency.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Study on Properties of Activities Scheduling Based on CPM Network
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: scheduling optimization; CPM network; n activities chain
Abstract: In this paper, properties of activities scheduling based on CPM network are introduced. The main content comprises as follow: Firstly, correlative conceptions are given, such as n activities chain, tardiness of activities chain, eigenvalue of activities chain, separation and series of activities chain, immobile value, barycenter of activity, tardiness of activities chain group, etc; secondly, primary properties belonging to n activities chain are descript; and finally, main theorems correlating to n activities chain are given, such as invariable theorem, series chain invariability theorem tardiness theorem, etc; thirdly, rules of n activities chain transformation are brought forward, such as fore-move theorem, back-move theorem, head metathesis theorem, etc, which are core of optimization theory of n activities chain. These conclusions express the properties and rules of scheduling parallel activities to ordinal activities under condition of lacking facilities, which could be used to solve classcal resource constrained project scheduling problem.

Article Title: Research on the Regularities of the Float Distribution in Network Planning
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: network planning; float; distribution Regularities
Abstract: Float is the core conception on network planning management. In this paper, theory of float's propertity is analyzed systemically, containing total float, free float, safety float and node float; regularities of the floats distribution on path in network planning are discovered, and many new rules and conclusions are found and made based on the above theory. the theory could help to advance the development of project schedule management, and provide theory and method for solving many classical problems.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: The Influence of Remuneration Committee over Pay-Performance Sensitivity in China
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Remuneration committee; Pay-performance sensitivity; Emerging markets
Abstract: This paper examines the role and function of Remuneration Committee in improving pay-performance sensitivity (PPS) in emerging markets. We conduct an exploratory analysis of the influence of remuneration committee on the PPS using proxy disclosures by a diverse sample of 9,616 firm-year observations. The PPS was compared before and after introduction of the remuneration committees. and statistical difference was observed. Listed companies with remuneration committees are associated with stronger incentives. When considering the factors that explain duration differences in the selection of remuneration committees, we find that companies with more ownership held by the largest shareholder or less sale revenues are more likely to form remuneration committees earlier. And the duration is shorter when the companies are State-owned enterprises (SOE). All of the coefficients are statistically significant even with industry and year controls.

Article Title: Study on the Shortest Path Problem in Indirectional Connective Graph with Positive Weight
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: operations research; non-directional connected graph; the shortest path model; muster algorithm
Abstract: Aiming at the Shortest Path Problem in Non-Directional Connected Graph with Positive Weight, the shortest path model in non-direction graph whose sides are certain or stochastic is established in this paper, and the optimal algorithm called muster algorithm is given which is based on the characteristics of the shortest path, the principles of phasing out, choosing merit and dynamic programming. The validity of muster algorithm is analyzed and probability analysis is made when sides of graph are stochastic. The theoretical analysis and numerical tests show that this model and the optimal algorithm are propitious to resolve the shortest path problem with moderate scale, and it is redound to develop operations research and graph theory.

Article Title: The World's Oil Export Capacity Forecast and Its Impact on China's Oil Import
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: export capacity; oil production; oil consumption; oil import
Abstract: The rapid growth of China's economy needs plenty of oil resources. Because of the domestic oil production shortage, China has become more and more dependent on the foreign oil import. The analysis shows the world's oil production will come into Peak Plateau between 2006 and 2016, indicating that the world's remaining oil export capacity will decrease continuously after the peak of 2.752 billion tons. In this case, China should take tough measures to reduce oil demand and exert great efforts to develop alternative energy to fight against the shortage of oil import.

Article Title: Study on Synergetic Effect on Logistics Base of the Core City in the New Economic Zone -Taking Nanning as A Case
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Beibu Gulf; Logistics Base; Nanning; Synergy
Abstract: The Beibu Gulf Economic Zone development strategy is not only an important part of the West Development Strategy of our country in the 21st Century, but is the first time to attempt the development of Transnational cooperation and being the pivotal city of marine channel of Southwest, and the development of Nanning which has been regarded as the bridgehead in Beibu Gulf is the core of it. From the good chances of the logistics development in Nanning, this paper introduces the wide prospect of it. Based on the effect and the status of the logistics base of the central cites in the new economic zone, the synergetic theory and the studies of the logistics base of Nanning, it puts forward the ideas of five synergies on the construction of logistics base in Nanning which includes the steps of the construction, the partnership, the mode of the service and the development of industry Further more, it systematically explains the meanings and actions of every synergy and shows the Directions of the logistics base in Nanning. Nanning should become an indispensable logistics node on the supply chain of the Beibu Gulf logistics.

Article Title: Construction of Water Resources Optimal Allocation and Its Cultural Algorithm of Interprovincial Boundary River
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: optimal allocation of water resources; multi-objectives model; cultural algorithm; constraints
Abstract: With the current social development and population growth, water shortage, water pollution and other problems have become more serious. How to fully utilize water resources reasonably and take any possible measures to satisfy people's needs become an urgent problem. Optimal allocation of water resources is one of the effective sustainable utilization of water resources. The optimal allocation model of water resources is established by taking maximum social benefit as the objectives. From the characteristics of the water resources optimal allocation of interprovincial boundary river,this paper get the numerical method and algorithm program of the optimal solution of the model by the cultural algorithm theory. Finally, taking an interprovincial river as a case, the water allocation of the water resources model is given. The application results show that the model and the algorithm are feasible and effective.

Article Title: A Brief Analysis On Multi-terminal-node Network-planning Diagram
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: multi-terminal-node; network-planning diagram; reserved time; characteristic
Abstract: This paper will derive the reserved time parameters in multi-terminal-node network-planning diagram and their numerical method from the theory in single-terminal-node network-planning diagram, initiatively study on the characteristic of reserved time in multi-terminal-node network-planning diagram. This paper will use the available parameter expressions and their theory in CPM model. At last, this paper will give the switching process and method of parameter expressions from single-terminal-node network-planning diagram to multi-terminal-node network-planning diagram.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Irregularities Regulation, Compensation Schemes of Management and Corporate Governance- Based on Empirical Researches on Punishment Bulletins of External Regulators
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Irregularities Regulation; Management Compensation; Punishment Bulletins
Abstract: Taking listed company of China Securities Market from 1999 to 2008 as samples to check the sensitive effects of irregularities regulation on the compensation schemes of management, this paper studies on company governance functions of external regulators exerting in the process of resolving the first kind of principal-agent problems. This study found that state-owned enterprises attach more emphasis on its reputation and social image. When regulators penalize listed company for irregularities, the latter would give the involved executives cash compensation penalty with the purpose of constraining their market behaviours and reducing the non-compliance issues. The empirical research discovers that external regulation has remarkable influence on the compensation schemes of management; the cash compensation penalty could effectively restrict the management behaviours and help reduce irregularities. The evidences supplied in this paper demonstrate that external regulation plays an outstanding company governancy role in relieving the principal-agent conflicts between the shareholders and company executives.

Abstract: The paper analyzes the risk of mutation process in the production process according to the distribution features of extreme events and the theory of extreme statistical based on the theory of traditional a tolerance quality management. Analysis shows that a tolerance level of quality management has close relation with the variance ratio of conditional expectations of extreme events, maximum and minimum order statistic distribution, and Eigen of extreme events distribution, which embodies importance of extreme events risk analysis in quality management

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Analysis on Transaction and Exploitation of the Controlling Shareholder Based on Limited Deviation
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: exploitation; excessive private benefits of control; the controlling shareholder
Abstract: The negative effect on the security development of the shareholder stems from the role for the exploitation over corporate resources. The question is whether exploitation by the controlling shareholder in listed enterprises or excessive private benefits of control is the one that many scholars have discussed so much. The analysis on transaction and exploitation of the controlling shareholder has become one of the main focuses in corporate finance and financial engineering. The substantial results on transaction and exploitation of the controlling shareholder based on limited deviation indicate that the exploitation of excessive private benefits of control is positively related to the SHS under the level of 5%, negatively related to the VAL under the level of 5%, and so forth. Results based on limited deviation indicate that corporate governance is the system of the listed factory. The policy meaning of what institutions can curb and have an effect on the exploitation is summarized consequently.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Determination Criteria of Evaluation Results
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Management Science and Engineering; Performance evaluationt; Quantitative model
Abstract: this paper is about the special phenomenon of evaluation in china. Chinese local governments have emphasized the implement quantitative evaluation and quantification of public expenditure. The paper makes hypothesis that quantitative evaluation is a decisive factor in the performance score, and then verify it. This paper uses quantitative model which shows that the decision is not quantified evaluation of china's performance score, but the other two kinds of evaluation indexes. Performance evaluation of Chinese Communist Party (CCP) and local government is system engineering. The paper uses the econometrics in accordance with evaluation practice, and tackles the original data of related investigation and study, finally makes quantitative analysis. The paper shows how to use econometrics to solve evaluation problems in government performance of China.

Authors: Chen, W; Sun, PN; Jia, SH
Book Editors: Qi, JX
Author Full Names: Chen, Wei; Sun, Pingna; Jia, Shanghui
Article Title: The Portfolio Model with RCaR Constraint and Its Application
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Portfolio investment; Capital-at-Risk; Short selling; Relative Capital-at-Risk
Abstract: Under the assumption of Black-Scholes Model, the Relative Capital-at-Risk constraint is introduced, which not only make the risk metrics has a more intuitive meaning, but also avoid the troubles of selecting the constraint upper bound caused by different initial wealth. On this basis, a Mean-RCaR Model is established to further analyze the optimal strategy for constant rebalanced portfolio, short selling is allowed and short selling is not allowed respectively. Under this model, all the market parameters were allowed to change with time. This paper gives the detail solving process of this model and then shows the explicit solution of optimal strategy. The results show that under this model, the two fund separation theorem still holds. In the end, this paper gives an example to further establish the application of this model and compare the result with the Mean-variance model.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Construction of Dispute Resolution Mechanism from the Overall Perspective
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Overall; Litigation Mechanism; Non-litigation Mechanism; Multiple Dispute Resolution Mechanism
Abstract: The dispute, as a social norm, is a symbiosis of human civilization. However, eliminating imbalances in social relations brought by various disputes to achieve social harmony and stability has always been the pursuit of social ideals. Then, properly handling and easing the social conflicts to resolve disputes has constituted an important part of achieving social harmony. Based on diverse interests and stakeholders, dispute resolution mechanism has showed a multiple state. Although a variety of dispute resolutions have existed for a long time, our country has not formed a mutual promotion effective mechanism among the various dispute resolutions, because each one always goes in its own way. Thus, the effect on the dispute resolution is not satisfying and far away from the need of building a harmonious society. In view of this, it is quite necessary to observe the pros and cons of litigation mechanism and non-litigation mechanism comprehensively and construct a multiple dispute resolution mechanism on the whole.

Authors: Liu, XY; Zhang, J; Ma, YJ
Book Editors: Qi, JX
Author Full Names: Liu, Xiyou; Zhang, Jie; Ma, Yuanju
Article Title: The Corporate Governance Role of the Media: A General Research Framework
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Media; Corporate Governance; Review
Abstract: Recent examples of corporate fraud have prompted scholars to look for new insights into corporate governance. The Article pursues the familiar theme but focuses on an area that has heretofore escaped close attention from researchers: the media coverage. The media maybe make many important contributions to our system of corporate governance. This article illustrates the ways that the media coverage is put to use by the various mechanisms that comprise the corporate governance system and explains several distinct roles played by the media. The Article concludes with indicating some of the shortcomings of the media and identifies directions for future research.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Study on Float Transitivity in CPM Network Planning
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: project plan management; float transitivity; CPM network planning; float
Abstract: Network planning is a basic tool applied to project plan management, and one of its cores is CPM network planning. Float transitivity matter in CPM network planning is that when one activity consumes its float, whether other activities' float would change or not following it, and what conditions and rules are, etc. Aiming at the matter, firstly, eigenvalue parameter is given based on total float, safe float, free float and node float; secondly, according to the parameter, change's conditions and rules of other activities' float are summed up under effect of one activity consuming its float, and relevant computational formulae are designed: thirdly, the correctness of these conclusions is analyzed; and finally, the feasibility is validated though examples.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Compatible with the Institute of Credit Management of Teaching
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: credit system; institute; teaching management
Abstract: The system of teaching management has been transformed from academic year to credit in most universities in China. Three levels of system has been established, that is, university-institute-department level and university-institute level. The emphasis of teaching management has been put on the institute level. Under such background, we have to face difficulties in the teaching management. This paper analyzed the position and function of institutes in the teaching management system, brought forth the suggestions about credit system and teaching management: that is, establishing teaching plan management system, teaching operation system, course-selected system, teaching quality management and assessment system, student-centered service system and relevant management system at the institute level. We also analyze and perfect the teaching management system and put forward some suggestions to solve the problems appeared in teaching management. By doing so, the management level will be raised and reform from academic year system to credit system will go smoothly.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Evolutionary Stability Analysis on Pro-environmental Behavior
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Pro-environmental strategy; Non-environment friendly strategy; Evolutionary stable strategy (ESS)
Abstract: What conditions can the replicator dynamics of consumers form pro-environmental evolutionary stable strategy? The Veblen effect model indicates that evolutionary stable strategy is signals which are unfavorable to ecological environment. The result presents that when the signal strategy is encouraged and the non-signal strategy is punished, the evolutionary direction is disadvantageous to the ecological environment. The solution of bandwagon effect model depends on the initial state. The results show the importance of raising the number of consumers which adopt pro-environmental strategy. General game model reveals that evolutionary direction is unfavorable to the ecological environment when the benefit of the pro-environmental strategy is less than that of the non-environment friendly strategy. Asymmetric game between government and consumers brings about results which depend on cost of consumers adopting pro-environmental strategy and benefit of the government supporting pro-environmental Behavior If government' supports are low, it is almost impossible to make the transition from non-environment friendly behavior to pro-environmental behavior.

Authors: Hou, JR; Zhao, XF; Gu, QX
Book Editors: Qi, JX
Author Full Names: Hou, Jianrong; Zhao, Xiaofeng; Gu, Qinxuan
Article Title: The Optimization Algorithm of the Equation Solution Based on Improving of Interval Spline Wavelet Algorithm
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: interval spline wavelet; wavelet base; interpolation-point method; PDE; derivative operator
Abstract: The Gibbs phenomenon appears on the edge when differential equation for the bond price of large viscosity coefficients is solved. How to eliminate the set of oscillatory phenomena with the solution of kinds of the PDE such as the Vasicek' bond equation has been a puzzle. The optimal approximation property is shown when the cubic spline interval wavelet is used in the interpolation-points. Based on the interval spline wavelet interpolation-points method, this paper presents a new algorithm of replacing derivative operator matrix of two order with two derivative operators of one order. Compared with the original algorithm, the new method has the error of interpolation of the same order and self:adapting ability. The method produces less oscillation for the numerical solution of Burgers equation when the viscosity coefficient is larger.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: The Serial Optimal Decision of Parallel Ordinal Chains with Float Time and Analysis of its Complexity
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: project scheduling; parallel ordinal chain; activity float; optimal decision; complexity
Abstract: The serial optimization of parallel ordinal chains is one focus on the network planning optimization. In order to provide thoughts for the solution to the sequencing optimal decision of n parallel ordinal chains, in this paper, ordinal optimization problem of two or three parallel activity chains is studied and solved, under conditions of considering float of each activity and not allowing blackout. The main propress of sovling the problem is that firstly, give conception of deficient value; secondly, deduce path length theorem and deficient value theorem which express the relation between scheduling activities and total duration; thirdly, find out new paths in process of scheduling activity chains by using these theorem, and design optimization algorithms to resolve the problem; and finally, analye complexity of the algorithms, and obtain complexity are O(n) and O(n(2)) respectively.

Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: CPM networks; time constraints; float
Abstract: In a traditional CPM network, it is assumed that an activity always begins after the completeness of all of its preceding activities But there are more strict requirements of start time of activities in practical applications where some forms of time constraints are attached to an activity. The analysis shows that floats in the context of a time-constrained activity network differ from those of a traditional activity network. In this paper, the float type of time-constrained networks is analyzed and the feature of the float is further discussed. It is put forward that different types of float in time-constrained network are different in workability and patterns of usage. The research conclusions in this paper provide more reasonable suggestions of making use of float fo project managers during executing and controlling activities.

This article designs the environment quality appraisal target system with the factor analytic method and the construction environment quality synthetic evaluation model, and then propose an empirical analysis to improve the environmental quality of northwest provinces and regions in china.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Correctness and Complexity Analysis to Simplify Large Type Network
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: project management; time-cost tradeoff problem; float; complexity
Abstract: In most time-cost networks, studies on simplification have been done. These studies try to simplify a network by reducing its dummy activities. However, as the number of dummy activities grows up quickly, the simplification only has limited effect. In view of the above conditions, Firstly, we address the problem on simplification of large type time-cost network. Secondly, we give out the method of compressing total duration of large and mega time-cost network to equivalent sub-networks, taking advantage of property of free float in the network. Thirdly, the correlation between free float of activity and its length of path is studied to deduce Path Length The my and Fore-Main Chain Theory. Furthermore, other theories about free float are deduced. Based on the above theories, in this paper, we provided the correctness and complexity analysis to simplify large type network. At last, by the example, we proved that the algorithm is practical and simple.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Research on the Transitivity and Stability of Float
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: network planning; float; transitivity; stability
Abstract: Network planning technology is one of the most important tools for project management, and float is the core content of the technology. In this paper. firstly, theory of float's property is analyzed systemically, which contain properties of total float. free float, safety float and node float; and secondly. transitivity and stability of floats in network planning are discovered, and many new rules and conclusions are found and made based on the above theory. The theory could help to advance the development of project plan and schedule management, and provide theory and method for solving many classical problems, such as the second longest path problem, the time-cost tradeoff problem, the resource leveling problem, etc.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Activities Scheduling by Minimum and Maximum Time and Distance Constraints with the Repetitive Scheduling Method (RSM)
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: RSM; time and distance constraints; positions of activities
Abstract: The minimum and maximum time and distance constraints often present in the repetitive scheduling method (RSM), and the positions of activities have to be sited by these constraints. However, the previous work had only paid close attention to the minimum time and constraints, yet overlooked the maximum time and constraints, but there are the maximum constraints in the actual production areas of life. The central research of this paper is for the determination of the position of activities when the minimum and maximum time and distance constraints coexist in the RSM. For identifying the positions of activities, firstly, upward the predecessor to form a new minimum time constraint range, secondly, upward the predecessor to form a new maximum time constraint range, the last, move the successor to the mid of the two ranges, identifying the last position of successor. The purpose of that is to make the method of determination more reasonable.

Book Editors: Qi, JX
Article Title: Sufficient Conditions of Minimal Perturbation Constraints Efficient Solution
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Nonlinear Programming; Minimal Perturbation Constraint; Minimal Perturbation Efficient Solution; Sufficient Conditions
Abstract: Nonlinear programming deals with the problem of optimizing an objective function in the presence of equality and inequality constraints of the nonlinear functions. The optimum value of an objective function in the presence of inequality constraints does not satisfy people's demand sometimes in the practical problems, so it is necessary to make the constraints perturbation when the optimum value of the objective function makes perturbation. In this paper, the nonlinear programming problem that the constraint perturbation attains minimum when the optimum valve of the objective function under the constraint conditionmakes perturbation is considered and some sufficient conditions of the minimal perturbation constraints efficient solution are given by using the theory and method of multiobjectives programming.

Article Title: Algorithm of Computing Float Mean and Variance of Network Planning
Source Title: 2010 CMSA OVERALL UNITED PLANNING SYMPOSIUM (OUPS 2010)
Conference Title: CMSA Overall United Planning Symposium
Conference Sponsor: Chinese Soc Optimizat, Overall Planning & Economic Math, Overall United Planning Comm
Author Keywords: Project Management; CPM Network; CPM Network Float; Float Mean and Variance
Abstract: Aiming at extending study of float from activity to whole network, new conceptions and theorems are proposed, and algorithm of float mean and variance is designed in this paper. Firstly, based on relevant knowledge of Probability and Statistic and trait of CPM network planning, conception of CPM network float is proposed, and Extremum of CPM network float theorem and sum theorem which represent the relation between float and Extremum of CPM network float are deduced. Secondly, float mean and variance are important parameters to analyze criticality and sensitivity of activity and contrast multi-CPM network planning. Based on above theorems, fuzzy algorithm of float mean and variance is designed, and application of the algorithm is demonstrated by illustrating.

Article Title: Using Consistent Fuzzy Preference Relations to Risk Factors Priority of Metropolitan Underground Project
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Abstract: To execute a large and complex underground project in metropolis will involve more risky factors. It is the successful implementation of such project depends on effective management of the key risk factors. This study cites the key risk factors of underground rail-way project identified by Ghosh and Jintanapakanont (2004) and uses the consistent fuzzy preference relations (CFPR) to deal with the degree of impact of these risk factors. It reveals that the CFPR is an easy and practical way to provide rankings of more risk factors in making decision and yields consistent requirement from only n - 1 pairwise comparisons.

Authors: Sun, S; Wu, JN; Xuan, ZX
Book Editors: Shi, Y; Wang, S; Peng, Y; Li, J; Zeng, Y
Author Full Names: Sun, Shu; Wu, Jiangning; Xuan, Zhaoguo
Article Title: Knowledge Diffusion on Networks through the Game Strategy
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: Knowledge diffusion; Game strategy; Network
Abstract: In this paper, we develop a knowledge diffusion model in which agents determine to give their knowledge to others according to some exchange strategies. The typical network namely small-world network is used for modeling, on which agents with knowledge are viewed as the nodes of the network and the edges are viewed as the social relationships for knowledge transmission. Such agents are permitted to interact with their neighbors repeatedly who have direct connections with them and accordingly change their strategies by choosing the most beneficial neighbors to diffuse knowledge. Two kinds of knowledge transmission strategies are proposed for the theoretical model based on the game theory and thereafter used in different simulations to examine the effect of the network structure on the knowledge diffusion effect. By analyses, two main observations can be found: One is that the simulation results are contrary to Our intuition which agents would like to only accept but not share, thus they will maximize their benefit; another one is that the number of the agents acquired knowledge and the corresponding knowledge stock turn out to be independent of the percentage of those agents who choose to contribute their knowledge.

Article Title: How Retailer Power Influence Its Opportunism Governance Mechanisms in Marketing Channel?-An Empirical Investigation in China
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: Power; Governance Mechanism; Communication; Monitoring; Opportunism
Abstract: This Study aims to investigate the relationship among power, norms, contract and opportunism, analysis the effect of retailer power on the choice of norms and contracts, examine the influence of retailer power on opportunism, and discuss the moderating effect of communication between retailer's power and governance mechanism, and also the moderating effect of monitoring between governance mechanism and opportunism. We got the following conclusions: (1) The retailer power affects supplier's choice of governance mechanisms. (2) The use of different types of governance mechanisms from supplier has a significant negative impact on retailer's opportunism behavior. (3) Communication significantly decreases the frequency of supplier's use of contract, but does not show a significant effect on decreasing the frequency of the use of norms; monitoring does not show a significant. moderating effect between governance mechanism and opportunism behavior.

Abstract: The maximum entropy (ME) method can be used to analyze the risk of mergers and acquisitions when only pre-acquisition information is available. A practical example of the risk analysis of China listed firms' mergers and acquisitions is provided to testify the feasibility and practicality of the method.

Author Full Names: Chen, Qi-an; Xiao, Yinghong; Chen, Hui; Chen, Liang
Article Title: The Effect of Subjective Risk Attitudes and Overconfidence on Risk Taking Behaviors: A Experimental Study Based on Traders of the Chinese Stock Market
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictit Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: Subjective Risk Attitude; Overconfidence; Risk Taking Behavior; Experimental Study; Chinese Stock Market
Abstract: Our research analyzes the effect of the traders' subjective risk attitude, optimism and overconfidence on their risk taking behaviors on the Chinese Stock Market by experimental study method. We find that investors' risk taking behavior is significantly affected by their subjective risk attitude, optimism and overconfidence. Our results also argue that the objective return and volatility of stock are not as good predictors of risk taking behavior as Subjective risk and return measures. Moreover, We illustrate that overconfidence and optimism have an significant impact on risk taking behavior In line with theoretical models.

Authors: Chen, YC; Lien, HP; Tzeng, GH; Yang, LS; Yen, L
Book Editors: Shi, Y; Wang, S; Peng, Y; Li, J; Zeng, Y
Author Full Names: Chen, Yi-Chun; Lien, Hui-Pang; Tzeng, Gwo-Hshiung; Yang, Lung-Shih; Yen, Leon
Article Title: Fuzzy MCDM Technique for Planning the Environment Watershed
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: environment-watershed plan; fuzzy analytic hierarchy process; fuzzy multiple criteria decision making
Abstract: In the real word, the decision making problems are very vague and uncertain in a number of ways. The most criteria have interdependent and interactive features so they cannot be evaluated by conventional measures method. Such as the feasibility, thus, to approximate the human subjective evaluation process, it Would be more suitable to apply a fuzzy method in environment-watershed plan topic. This paper describes the design of a fuzzy decision support system in multi-criteria analysis approach for selecting the best plan alternatives or strategies in environment-watershed. The Fuzzy Analytic Hierarchy Process (FAHP) method is used to determine the preference weightings of criteria for decision makers by subjective perception. A questionnaire was used to find out from three related groups comprising fifteen experts. Subjectivity and vagueness analysis is dealt with the criteria and alternatives for selection process and simulation results by using fuzzy numbers with linguistic terms. Incorporated the decision makers' attitude towards preference, overall performance value of each alternative can be obtained based on the concept of Fuzzy Multiple Criteria Decision Making (FMCDM). This research also gives an example of evaluating consisting of five alternatives, solicited from a environment-watershed plan works in Taiwan, is illustrated to demonstrate the effectiveness and usefulness of the proposed approach.

Article Title: Methodology for Knowledge Synthesis
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Abstract: This paper considers the problem of knowledge synthesis and proposes a theory of knowledge construction, which consists of three fundamental parts: a knowledge integration model, the structure-agency-action paradigm, and the evolutionally constructive objectivism. The first is a model of gathering and integrating knowledge, the second relates to necessary abilities when gathering knowledge in individual domains, and the third comprises a set of principles to evaluate gathered and integrated knowledge.

Article Title: An Evolutionary Algorithm for the Multi-objective Multiple Knapsack Problem
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: Evolutionary algorithms; Multiple knapsack problem
Abstract: In this study, we consider the multi-objective multiple knapsack problem (MMKP) and we adapt our favorable weight based evolutionary algorithm (FWEA) to approximate the efficient frontier of MMKP. The algorithm assigns fitness to solutions based on their relative strengths as well as their non-dominated frontiers. The relative strength is measured based on a weighted Tchebycheff distance from the ideal point where each Solution chooses its own weights that minimize its distance from the ideal point. We carry Out experiments on test data for MMKP given in the literature and compare the performance of the algorithm with several leading algorithms.

Article Title: Research on Customer Value Based on Extension Data Mining
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: extension data mining; extension knowledge; extensible classification knowledge; conductive knowledge
Abstract: Extenics is a new discipline for dealing with contradiction problems with formulize model. Extension data mining (EDM) is a product combining Extenics with data mining. It explores to acquire the knowledge based on extension transformations, which is called extension knowledge (EK), taking advantage of extension methods and data mining technology. EK includes extensible classification knowledge, conductive knowledge and so on. Extension data mining technology (EDMT) is a new data mining technology that mining EK in databases or data warehouse. Customer value (CV) can weigh the essentiality of customer relationship for an enterprise according to an enterprise as a subject of tasting value and Customers as objects of tasting value at the same time. CV varies continually. Mining the changing knowledge of CV in databases using EDMT, including quantitative change knowledge and qualitative change knowledge, can provide a foundation for that an enterprise decides the strategy of customer relationship management (CRM). It can also provide a new idea for Studying CV.

Article Title: Estimation of Value-at-Risk for Energy Commodities via CAViaR Model
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Abstract: This paper uses the Conditional Autoregressive Value at Risk model (CAViaR) proposed by Engle and Manganelli (2004) to evaluate the value-at-risk for daily spot prices of Brent crude oil and West Texas Intermediate crude oil covering the period May 21(th), 1987 to November 18(th), 2008. Then the accuracy of the estimates of CAViaR model, Normal-GARCH, and GED-GARCH was compared. The results show that all the methods do good job for the low confidence level (95%), and GED-GARCH is the best for spot WTI price, Normal-GARCH and Adaptive-CAViaR are the best for spot Brent price. However, for the high confidence level (99%), Normal-GARCH do a good job for spot WTI, GED-GARCH and four kind of CAViaR specifications do well for spot Brent price. Normal-GARCH does badly for spot Brent price. The result seems Suggest that CAViaR do well as well as GED-GARCH since CAViaR directly model the quantile autoregression, but it does not outperform GED-GARCH although it does Outperform Normal-GARCH.

Authors: Yang, YPO; Shieh, HM; Tzeng, GH
Book Editors: Shi, Y; Wang, S; Peng, Y; Li, J; Zeng, Y
Author Full Names: Yang, Yu-Ping Ou; Shieh, How-Ming; Tzeng, Gwo-Hshiung
Article Title: A VIKOR Technique with Applications Based on DEMATEL and ANP
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: VIKOR; analytic network process (ANP); DEMATEL; multiple criteria decision making (MCDM)
Abstract: In multiple criteria decision making (MCDM) methods, the compromise ranking method (named VIKOR) was introduced as one applicable technique to implement within MCDM. It was developed for multicriteria optimization of complex systems. However, few papers discuss conflicting (competing) criteria with dependence and feedback in the compromise solution method. Therefore, this study proposes and provides applications for a novel model using the VIKOR technique based on DEMATEL and the ANP to solve the problem of conflicting criteria with dependence and feedback. In addition, this research also uses DEMATEL to normalize the unweighted supermatrix of the ANP to suit the real world. An example is also presented to illustrate the proposed method with applications thereof. The results show the proposed method is suitable and effective in real-world applications.

Article Title: Size, Book-to-Market Ratio and Relativity of Accounting Information Value: Empirical Research on the Chinese Listed Company
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Abstract: Recently there are many literatures studying the effect of factors such as size or book-market ratio on fluctuation of accounting earnings, stock price or earnings respectively, but so far their affection on accounting information value relativity has been scarcely addressed. This paper presents the detail analyses of their effect of the two factors to the relativity of accounting information value respectively by taking Shanghai and Shenzhen stock markets as sample. And the analyses supports the following two hypotheses, (1) The relativity of accounting information value of big size corporation is more than that of small size corporation. (2) The relativity of accounting information value of low B/M ratio corporation is more than that of low B/M ratio corporation.

Author Full Names: Zhang, Wen; Tang, Xijin; Yoshida, Taketoshi
Article Title: A Comparison of SVD, SVR, ADE and IRR for Latent Semantic Indexing
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: Latent Semantic Indexing; Singular Value Decomposition; Singular Value Rescaling; Approximation Dimension Equalization; Iterative Residual Rescaling
Abstract: Recently, singular value decomposition (SVD) and its variants, which are singular value rescaling (SVR), approximation dimension equalization (ADE) and iterative residual rescaling (IRR), were proposed to conduct the job of latent semantic indexing (LSI). Although they are all based on linear algebraic method for tem-document matrix computation, which is SVD, the basic motivations behind them concerning LSI are different from each other. In this paper, a series of experiments are conducted to examine their effectiveness of LSI for the practical application of text mining, including information retrieval, text categorization and similarity measure. The experimental results demonstrate that SVD and SVR have better performances than other proposed LSI methods in the above mentioned applications. Meanwhile, ADE and IRR, because of the too much difference between their approximation matrix and original term-document matrix in Frobenius norm, can not derive pod performances for text mining applications using LSI.

Article Title: The Heterogeneous Investment Horizon and Dynamic Strategies for Asset Allocation
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: The Heterogeneous Investment Horizon; The buy-and-hold Strategy; The stochastic Rebalancing Strategy; The simple Rebalancing Strategy
Abstract: This paper discusses the influence of the portfolio rebalancing strategy oil the efficiency of long-term investment portfolios under the assumption of independent stationary distribution of returns. By comparing the efficient sets of the stochastic rebalancing strategy, the simple rebalancing strategy and the buy-and-hold strategy with specific data examples, we find that the stochastic rebalancing strategy is optimal, while the simple rebalancing strategy is of the lowest efficiency. In addition, the simple rebalancing strategy lowers the efficiency of the portfolio instead of improving it.

Abstract: In this paper, we design a mechanism which can measure the affinity between knowledge and user, affinity among users to achieve the intelligent management of knowledge. Based on the affinity, we can implement knowledge push to provide the right knowledge to the right person automatically. Several matrixes are designed to calculate the affinity.

Article Title: Dynamic Project Risk Analysis and Management Based on Influence Diagrams
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: influence diagram; network planning; dynamic risk management
Abstract: This paper presents a real-time process-oriented project risk analysis and management model which can be combined with the project general management, based oil the hierarchical risk influence diagram which is constructed on the basis of network planning, Through network planning, it can solve the problems of the dynamic and overall identification of risk elements, and the showing and analysis of risk transfer along with the working procedure, and the timely and dynamic risk prevention and control as well. The influence diagram can effectively represent the risk combination and transfer in time and logic order. And it is good at the analysis of the sensitivity and control value of risk elements, as well as being convenient for communicating between experts, managers and owner. So the hierarchical risk influence diagram can make the decision of risk management timelier and more accurate. The problems of risk description, diagrams construction and risk evaluation are solved very well in applying the general influence diagram to dynamic project risk analysis. In the end, good result is attained in the example.

Article Title: A Novel MCQP Approach for Predicting the Distance Range between Interface Residues in Antibody-Antigen Complex
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Abstract: Anti body-antigen association plays a key role in immune system. The distance range between interface residues in protein complex is one of interface features. Three machine learning approaches, known as Multiple Criteria Quadratic Programming (MCQP), Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) (SPSS 2004) and Decision Tree based See5 (Quinlan 2003), are used to predict the distance range between interface residues in antigen-antibody complex. It is explored that how different Surface patch size affects the accuracy of different distance range. The results of three approaches are compared with each other.

Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictit Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska, Omaha
Abstract: Factors that caused slow growth in crop insurance participation and its ultimate failure in China were multi-faceted including high agricultural production risk, low participation rate, inadequate public awareness, high loss ratio, insufficient and interrupted government financial support. Thus, a clear and present need for data driven analyses and empirically-based risk management exists in China. In the present investigation, agricultural production data for two crops (corn, rice) in five counties in Jiangxi Province and Hunan province for design of a pilot crop insurance program in China. A crop insurance program was designed which (1) provides 75% coverage, (2) a 55% premium rate reduction for the farmer compared to catastrophic coverage most recently offered, and uses the currently approved governmental premium subsidy level. Thus a safety net for Chinese farmers that help maintain agricultural production at a level of self-sufficiency that costs less than half the current plans requires one change to the program: >= 80% of producers must participate in an area.

Article Title: Study on the Developing Mechanism of Financial Network
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: financial network; weight; degree distribution; developing mechanism
Abstract: Financial network is a capital flow network made up of a great number of account nodes. Based on the theories of Economic Physics, Behavior Economics and Complex Networks, the developing model of financial network has been constructed from the point of the weight properties of vertices and edges in financial network. According to the parsing of the model, it presents that the financial network shows a power-law degree distribution (P-k similar to k(-2)) in the condition that the time tends to infinity. Finally, the degree distribution of financial network is simulated with the experimental data on this thesis.

Article Title: Detection of Outliers from the Lognormal Distribution in Financial Economics
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making

Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictit Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska, Omaha
Abstract: The lognormal distribution is widely applied in many fields such as economics, finance, management. A method for detection of the outliers from the lognormal sample is discussed. The new test statistics based on the superior estimators for the population parameters are given. The test statistics can resist contamination from the outliers, the approximate distribution of the test statistics is proposed in this article.

Article Title: Measuring Interdependency among Industrial Chains with Financial Data
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making

Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictit Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska, Omaha
Abstract: Industrial chains exhibit strong interdependency within a large-scale resource-based enterprise group. When analyzing the independency effect ill industrial chains, the interdependency of financial index is often ignored. In this paper, we will mainly focus oil measuring the long-term interdependency effect by historical Simulation and cointegration tests with financial data. A large-scale coal-mining group is Studied empirically as a case to explain the framework of independency analysis among the industrial chains. The results show that high degree of independency appears in production costs and marketing costs, and low degree appears in revenues and profits.

Article Title: Country Risk Volatility Spillovers of Emerging Oil Economies: An Application to Russia and Kazakhstan
Source Title: CUTTING-EDGE RESEARCH TOPICS ON MULTIPLE CRITERIA DECISION MAKING, PROCEEDINGS
Book Series Title: Communications in Computer and Information Science
Conference Title: 20th International Conference on Multiple Criteria Decision Making
Conference Location: Univ Elect Sci & Technol China, Chengdu, PEOPLES R CHINA
Conference Sponsor: Res Ctr Fictitious Econ & Data Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Acad Math & Syst Sci,Chinese Acad Sci,Univ Nebraska
Author Keywords: emerging oil economy; country risk; volatility spillover
Abstract: The emerging oil economies (EOEs) of geographical proximity, are usually impacted by some common risk factors which may make the interaction of their country risk closely related. This paper focuses on the interaction of country risk between EOEs by investigating the volatility spillovers of country risk. Taking Russia and Kazakhstan for example, a multivariate conditional volatility model is used to capture the dynamic spillovers of country risk. Empirical results show that there are significant bidirectional spillover effects with the asymmetrical volatility between Russia and Kazakhstan.
